qas.question: What did Hayek suggest as an alternative to being called a libertarian?
In opposition to conservatives, what group has Hayek's work influenced?
Who wrote an essay as a result of Hayek's "Why I Am Not a Conservative"?
From whom did Hayek acquire the term he proposed as an alternative to libertarian?
In his later years, what term did Hayek use to describe himself?

context: However, for his part, Hayek found this term "singularly unattractive" and offered the term "<a0_0>Old Whig<a0_0/>" (a phrase borrowed from <a3_0>Edmund Burke<a3_0/>) instead. In his later life, he said, "I am becoming <a4_0>a Burkean Whig<a4_0/>." However, Whiggery as a political doctrine had little affinity for classical political economy, the tabernacle of the Manchester School and William Gladstone. His essay has served as an inspiration to other <a1_0>liberal-minded economists<a1_0/> wishing to distinguish themselves from conservative thinkers, for example <a2_0>James M. Buchanan<a2_0/>'s essay "Why I, Too, Am Not a Conservative: The Normative Vision of Classical Liberalism".
